message: This is rather last minute, but I want a rough count for how many people would like to put a pre-paid sim in their foreign phone - and in particular how many iPhone micro-sim adapters might be needed
@voidspace - oh!  good catch (cutter comes w/ 3, so all I need is cutter.... ok)
the adaptors are to use a micro-sim in a phone that takes *standard* sims
pre-paid sim++ (not iphone)
Ooh me, me me (yes iphone micro-sim - but I don't need the adaptor just the sim cutting down)
so you don't need an adaptor if you're only going to use the sim as a micro-sim
adapters are nice if people have more than one phone, but I don't think many people will want / need them

Here's the story:   I'll bring some $10 prepaid T-Mobile cards;  they give a limited 10 minutes of talk, but you can refill them from your phone, with your credit card.   You can also buy 24 hr. unlimited data access for $1.49/day (I can't vouch for how well it works from the hotel).   I'm also trying to make sure we have a cutter for cutting down to micro-sims for iPhone/iPad.
@yarkot that sounds awesome - thanks dude
@cajun.coder:  thanks for calling and offering to bring by the cutter! See you next week!
Count me in for an iPhone micro-sim, thanks! :)
@voidspace: got a volunteer mule in ATA, but also found a version of the cutter that Amazon fulfills - just ordered one-day, will bring it with me.   We should be good to go.
@szilveszter, @voidspace, @jaaaarel - you're in.
Any chance of getting an at&t sim? I'm pretty sure my 3G won't work with T-Mobile (Btw, You're right that net10's "unlimited web access" is a sham)
You should google this - as far as I have seen, you cannot get a data plan on an AT&T prepaid sim.
why there aren't vending machines at all international airports selling these baffles me...
@thinkeryzu - ok;  I'll have one for you also, along with @szilveszter, @voidspace, @jaaaarel
@yarkot: count me if there are available cards.
Am I too late to get on board? Just woke and saw this. (non iphone)
@yarkot If threre's still time, count me in!
Yeah, you'll need an unlocked phone I guess.
Note that in the US phones are typically supplied locked to a given network, and if you don't plan to use an unlocked phone there may be carrier issues and "any old SIM" may not work

Update:   I'm bringing the SIM cutter for i-Phone users (it will be at the registration desk).   You can get from the Hyatt to the T-Mobile store in Atlanta (http://bit.ly/gJwtd4)  in about 11 minutes (Rail + 3 block walk - ttp://bit.ly/iieS7o).  This way, you may be able to try a sim in your phone before you buy.  I've talked to them, and they should have enough pre-paid sims on hand for this crowd.  $10 prepaid T-Mobile cards (10 minutes talk time included; other pre-paid options available); 24hr unlimited data access for $1.49/day - you can add/pay from your phone w/ the sim / credit card.   Hope this works out / helps.
@holdenweb is correct - I used to have "bags" of unlocked phones (no more).

Ugh!  T-Mobile phone help told me the wrong thing:  24 hour access is $1.49 per HOUR (not per 24hr)....  calculating @ 12 hr days, that would be > $80USD for 5 days;  here are other pre-paid options: http://bit.ly/hGLI4Z
@yarkot seeing these prices i'd rather pass on the sim card. $1.49/day sounds so much better :( hope you haven't bought any sims yet.
@szilverster - nope; not going to buy any, since it's a 11 minutes trek for anyone who wants to try.   I did buy / will have a sim-cutter for anyone who has an iPhone / micro-sim
@yarkot great, thanks for all the help!
@szilveszter np!  Safe journey -  see you in Atlanta!
$1.49 an hour sucks. :-(
It is unbelievable for me, a guy from Taiwan, to pay $1.49 for an hour.
@voidspace - indeed, it does suck...
Yikes.  Okay, thanks for the updates!
